result.value: A network based gene classification library to generate genome wide predictions about genes that are functionally similar to the input gene list.
A Python package of the GenePlexus analysis pipeline.

1. Install doc dependencies ``pip install -r docs/requirements.txt``
2. Build
```bash
cd docs
make html
```
3. Open doc ``open build/html/index.html``

Install the ``GenePlexus`` package via ``pip``.

```bash
pip install geneplexus
```

Run the default test suite
```bash
pytest test/
```
By default, test data will be cached. Thus, after the first test run, data redownload will not be tested. To force redownload, specify the ``--cache-clear`` option
```bash
pytest test/ --cache-clear
```

Run the default test suite
```bash
pytest test/
```
By default, test data will be cached. Thus, after the first test run, data redownload will not be tested. To force redownload, specify the ``--cache-clear`` option
```bash
pytest test/ --cache-clear
```

Copyright (c) 2022 Krishnan Laboratory at Michigan State University

The software is released under the [BSD 3-Clause License](https://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause).

## License information for data used

* STRING, STRING-EXP, GO use [Creative Commons License: Attribution 4.0 International](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode).
* DisGeNet uses [Creative Commons License: Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/legalcode).
* BioGRID uses [The MIT License](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT).

The location of the license agreement of terms-of-use for each network or
geneset collection can be found below. We note that no license agreement was
available for GIANT. However, we have obtained permission from the owner of the
material to redistribute the network and they have noted that they will be
adding a [Creative Commons License: Attribution 4.0 International](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode) to the website soon.

* [STRING](https://string-db.org/cgi/access.pl?footer_active_subpage=licensing)
* [BioGRID](https://wiki.thebiogrid.org/doku.php/terms_and_conditions)
* [GO](http://geneontology.org/docs/go-citation-policy/)
* [DisGeNet](https://www.disgenet.org/legal)

result.description:
## What's Changed
* changed to using sphinx.ext.napoleon not sphinxcontrib.napoleon by @ChristopherMancuso in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/288
* update rtd config by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/296

## Dependencies

* [pre-commit.ci] pre-commit autoupdate by @pre-commit-ci in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/279
* Bump pyyaml from 6.0 to 6.0.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/276
* Bump pytest from 7.2.0 to 7.4.2 by @dependabot in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/291
* Bump tox from 4.6.4 to 4.11.4 by @dependabot in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/295

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/compare/v1.0.0...v1.0.1
result.name: v1.0.1

result.description:
## What's Changed
* Update data v1.2, download zip files instead by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/64
* Test custom module by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/65
* Hotfix doc by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/66
* Multithreaded GET with persistent HTTP sessions by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/67
* References and license by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/68
* Fix typo and add LICENSE by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/70
* Patch CLI by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/91
* Patch data directories by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/92
* Check param via property by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/93
* Use zip instead of tar gz for windows users by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/94
* Download debug log by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/95
* Warn overwriting files by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/96
* Dump config by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/97
* Test dump config by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/98
* Create dependabot.yml by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/99
* Custom network validation by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/104
* Patch cross validation by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/110
* Overwrite option by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/112
* CLI skip model similarity analysis, save run log by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/114
* Max download retry by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/115
* Add more support by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/118
* Doc overview by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/116
* Minor doc fixes by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/126
* Update API examples and defaults by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/128
* Download log by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/133
* Add explicit links to doc by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/137
* Add option for skipping cross validation by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/145
* Improve custom network and gsc checks by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/148
* Bump numpy from 1.22.3 to 1.22.4 by @dependabot in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/147
* Update docs by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/156
* Update docs (consistent notation + reorganize) by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/160
* Updated overview figure and product list by @ChristopherMancuso in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/174
* Custom check by @ChristopherMancuso in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/179
* Download tests by @ChristopherMancuso in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/189
* fix typo by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/202
* fix file handler not closed issue on windows machines by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/203
* change software license to BSD3 by @RemyLau in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/211
* added eval info to docs by @ChristopherMancuso in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/212

## New Contributors
* @dependabot made their first contribution in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/100
* @pre-commit-ci made their first contribution in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/108
* @ChristopherMancuso made their first contribution in https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/pull/174

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/krishnanlab/PyGenePlexus/compare/v0.4...v1.0.0

result.name: PyGenePlexus v1.0.0-dev.2 pre-release

result.value:
```bash
geneplexus --input_file example/input_genes.txt --output_dir example_result
```

Full CLI options (check out with ``geneplexus --help``)

```txt
Run the GenePlexus pipline on a input gene list.

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -i , --input_file     Input gene list (.txt) file (one gene per line). (default: None)
  -d , --gene_list_delimiter
                        Delimiter used in the gene list. Use 'newline' if the genes are separated
                        by new line, and use 'tab' if the genes are seperate by tabs. Other
                        generic separator are also supported, e.g. ', '. (default: newline)
  -n , --network        Network to use. {format_choices(config.ALL_NETWORKS)} (default: STRING)
  -f , --feature        Types of feature to use. The choices are: {Adjacency, Embedding,
                        Influence} (default: Embedding)
  -g , --gsc            Geneset collection used to generate negatives and the modelsimilarities.
                        The choices are: {GO, DisGeNet} (default: GO)
  -s , --small_edgelist_num_nodes
                        Number of nodes in the small edgelist. (default: 50)
  -dd , --data_dir      Directory in which the data are stored, if set to None, then use the
                        default data directory ~/.data/geneplexus (default: None)
  -od , --output_dir    Output directory with respect to the repo root directory. (default:
                        result/)
  -l , --log_level      Logging level. The choices are: {CRITICAL, ERROR, WARNING, INFO, DEBUG}
                        (default: INFO)
  -q, --quiet           Suppress log messages (same as setting log_level to CRITICAL). (default:
                        False)
  -z, --zip-output      If set, then compress the output directory into a Zip file. (default:
                        False)
  --clear-data          Clear data directory and exit. (default: False)
  --overwrite           Overwrite existing result directory if set. (default: False)
  --skip-mdl-sim        Skip model similarity computation. This computation is not yet available
                        when using custom networks due to the lack of pretrained models for
                        comparison. (default: False)
```
See `example/example_run.py` for example usage of the API.

```bash
geneplexus --input_file example/input_genes.txt --output_dir example_result
```

Full CLI options (check out with ``geneplexus --help``)

```txt
Run the GenePlexus pipline on a input gene list.

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -i , --input_file     Input gene list (.txt) file (one gene per line). (default: None)
  -d , --gene_list_delimiter
                        Delimiter used in the gene list. Use 'newline' if the genes are separated
                        by new line, and use 'tab' if the genes are seperate by tabs. Other
                        generic separator are also supported, e.g. ', '. (default: newline)
  -n , --network        Network to use. {format_choices(config.ALL_NETWORKS)} (default: STRING)
  -f , --feature        Types of feature to use. The choices are: {Adjacency, Embedding,
                        Influence} (default: Embedding)
  -g , --gsc            Geneset collection used to generate negatives and the modelsimilarities.
                        The choices are: {GO, DisGeNet} (default: GO)
  -s , --small_edgelist_num_nodes
                        Number of nodes in the small edgelist. (default: 50)
  -dd , --data_dir      Directory in which the data are stored, if set to None, then use the
                        default data directory ~/.data/geneplexus (default: None)
  -od , --output_dir    Output directory with respect to the repo root directory. (default:
                        result/)
  -l , --log_level      Logging level. The choices are: {CRITICAL, ERROR, WARNING, INFO, DEBUG}
                        (default: INFO)
  -q, --quiet           Suppress log messages (same as setting log_level to CRITICAL). (default:
                        False)
  -z, --zip-output      If set, then compress the output directory into a Zip file. (default:
                        False)
  --clear-data          Clear data directory and exit. (default: False)
  --overwrite           Overwrite existing result directory if set. (default: False)
  --skip-mdl-sim        Skip model similarity computation. This computation is not yet available
                        when using custom networks due to the lack of pretrained models for
                        comparison. (default: False)
```
